page.title: 01West Lumsden/Huntly Road
page.content: Near, and parallel to, the eastern edge of this block lies a main road which , at the southern edge, leaves the village of Lumsden and runs north, toward Huntly. Less than half the village, which has a total of about 250 inhabitants, lies in this block but this part does contain church (Church of Scotland) a small Roman catholic chapel, a hotel and Scottish Sculptue Workshop. Most of block consists of fairly level land, an average altitude of about 200m. The land covering, however is diversified. basically it consists of farmland worked under rotation crops but this is interspersed with woodland, peat moss and a few grassy hills. Near the south west corner are the policies of Clova House, consisting mainly of broadleaved trees, is a steep valley planted also with broadleaved trees,
